com.navis.framework.presentation.charting

Class ChartPresentationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.presentation.charting.ChartPresentationUtils

  • public class ChartPresentationUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has utility methods for chart presentation.
    Author:
    Gisella Saavedra, Apr 12, 2011

      • verifyVariformType

        public static boolean verifyVariformType(@NotNull
                                         VariformTypeEnum inExpectedVariformType,
                                         java.lang.String inVariformId,
                                         boolean inMustExist)
        Checks whether a give variformId is of a certain type.
        Parameters:
        inExpectedVariformType - expected type of the variform
        inVariformId - variformId
        inMustExist - true if it must exist; false, otherwise (might not have been parsed or created so far)
        Returns:
        true if variformId found and it is of expected type

      • getGadgetRuntimeProperty

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Object getGadgetRuntimeProperty(@NotNull
                                                                   IGadget inGadget,
                                                                   @NotNull
                                                                   java.lang.String inPropertyName)
        Returns the value of the requested runtime property. These properties are used once the gadget has been instantiated and some properties of the underlying runtime or rendering engine need to be cached. ChartManagers are singletons, so there is no state kept.

        For example, a tableViewChart, since it is very different from the JFree charts, requires the information regarding its controller.

        Parameters:
        inGadget - gadget object
        inPropertyName - property name
        Returns:
        property value

      • getChartPropertyKeyPath

        public static java.lang.String getChartPropertyKeyPath(@NotNull
                                                       IGadget inGadget,
                                                       @NotNull
                                                       java.lang.String inProperty)
        Builds a property key path similar to the ones generated by XSLT for an application UI. E.g., "variform.MY_GADGET_ID.pieChart.title" where title is the inProperty.
        Parameters:
        inGadget - gadget instance
        inProperty - property to build the key path for
        Returns:
        property key path

      • getChartTranslatedAttribute

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getChartTranslatedAttribute(@NotNull
                                                                      RequestContext inRequestContext,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      IGadget inGadget,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String inAttrName,
                                                                      java.lang.String inAttrValue)
        Gets the translated attribute value for a gadget element. If the attribute value is NULL or empty, it returns NULL. This means that any overridden definition has to provide all fields.
        Parameters:
        inRequestContext - request context
        inGadget - gadget object
        inAttrName - attribute name, e.g., title
        inAttrValue - current attribute value as parsed.
        Returns:
        final text value of an attribute, to be rendered on the user's screen

      • resolveKey

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String resolveKey(@NotNull
                                                     MessageTranslator inMessageTranslator,
                                                     java.lang.Object inKey)
        Resolves a given key into a String.
        Parameters:
        inMessageTranslator - message translator
        inKey - key to resolve. It could be an AtomizedEnum, a PropertyKey, a metafieldId, a String, or NULL.
        Returns:
        NULL if key is NULL; otherwise string value of key.

      • calculateMajorTickIncrement

        public static double calculateMajorTickIncrement(double inLowerBound,
                                                 double inUpperBound,
                                                 int inDesiredTickCount)
        JFree charting has major and minor ticks. Calculates the major tick increment, given a desire number of ticks.
        Parameters:
        inLowerBound - lower bound value
        inUpperBound - upper bound value
        inDesiredTickCount - desired number of major ticks
        Returns:
        major tick increment

      • convertGadgetProperties

        public static void convertGadgetProperties(java.util.Map<?,?> inSourceProperties,
                                           @NotNull
                                           java.util.Map<MetafieldId,java.lang.Object> inOutTargetProperties)
        Converts various types of gadget/chart properties to a Map<MetafieldId, Object> and adds them to the target map.
        Parameters:
        inSourceProperties - the source properties to be converted (e.g., from XML parsing)
        inOutTargetProperties - the result map, after conversion, if needed.

      • convertGadgetProperties

        public static java.util.Map<MetafieldId,java.lang.Object> convertGadgetProperties(java.util.Map<?,?> inSourceProperties)
        Converts various types of gadget/chart properties to a Map<MetafieldId, Object>
        Parameters:
        inSourceProperties - the source properties to be converted (e.g., from XML parsing)
        Returns:
        Ceded exposed map.

      • mergeFilterProperties

        public static void mergeFilterProperties(@NotNull
                                         java.util.Map<MetafieldId,java.lang.Object> inOutTargetProperties,
                                         java.util.Map<MetafieldId,MetafieldId> inFilter,
                                         @NotNull
                                         ValueHolder inRowValues)
        Overrides target property values with table row property values, in accordance with the property mapping defined by a filter. Only affects the target property values -- does not add or remove target property entries. The intent is for the target properties to correspond to the editable properties of a chart in a table row, with the filter defining which row properties an override the editable properties.
        Parameters:
        inOutTargetProperties - Target properties.
        inFilter - Row to target property filter.
        inRowValues - Table row properties.

      • parseFilterRefProperties

        public static java.util.Map<MetafieldId,MetafieldId> parseFilterRefProperties(java.lang.String inFilterRef)
        Parses the filterRef property of a chart metafield. The destination field is the one associated with a chart. The source metafield is the one used for later on, retrieving data, it is the table row field. The data will be used to draw the chart Example: 
         
  <gui>
       <widget type="image" subType="chart">
           <chart>
               <variformId>MY_BULLET_CHART_2</variformId>
              <filterRef>ctcontainerNumber</filterRef>
          </chart>
      </widget>
   </gui>

        This could be a ,-separated list of mfld1o=mfld1i,mfld2,mfld3

        Parameters:
        inFilterRef - XML text corresponding to the XML definition for filterRef, to parse
        Returns:
        a map collection of mapped fields, destinationField, sourceField

      • createChart

        @Nullable
public static ICarinaChart<?> createChart(@NotNull
                                                     MetafieldId inMetafieldId,
                                                     ValueHolder inRowValues,
                                                     GuiWidgetEntry.ChartInfo inChartInfo)
        Creates an ICarinaChart from the metafield information. A chart points to a gadget variform. The reason for passing all the field values for the row is that the chart field might, most commonly, depend on the values of other fields in the same row.
        Parameters:
        inMetafieldId - metafield ID
        inRowValues - a valueHolder object containing the field values of a row
        inChartInfo - chart information object
        Returns:
        the graphical chart object
